name: rediscloud
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing rediscloud cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`rediscloud` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-rediscloud).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing rediscloud cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-rediscloud)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-rediscloud` repo](https://github.com/RedisLabs/pulumi-rediscloud/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-rediscloud` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-rediscloud/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-rediscloud)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-rediscloud` repo](https://github.com/RedisLabs/pulumi-rediscloud/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-rediscloud` repo](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-rediscloud/issues).

apiKey.description:
This is the Redis Cloud API key. It must be provided but can also be set by the `REDISCLOUD_ACCESS_KEY` environment
variable.

secretKey.description:
This is the Redis Cloud API secret key. It must be provided but can also be set by the `REDISCLOUD_SECRET_KEY`
environment variable.

url.description:
This is the URL of Redis Cloud and will default to `https://api.redislabs.com/v1`. This can also be set by the
`REDISCLOUD_URL` environment variable.

provider.description:
The provider type for the rediscloud package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

environment variable.

`REDISCLOUD_URL` environment variable.

cloudProvider.description: A cloud provider string either GCP or AWS

creationPlan.description:
Information about the planned databases used to optimise the database infrastructure. This information is only used when
creating a new subscription and any changes will be ignored after this.

name.description: A meaningful name to identify the subscription

paymentMethod.description: Payment method for the requested subscription. If credit card is specified, the payment method Id must be defined.

paymentMethodId.description: A valid payment method pre-defined in the current account

creationPlan.description:
Information about the planned databases used to optimise the database infrastructure. This information is only used when
creating a new subscription and any changes will be ignored after this.

memoryStorage.description: Memory storage preference: either ram or a combination of 'ram-and-flash

name.description: A meaningful name to identify the subscription

paymentMethod.description: Payment method for the requested subscription. If credit card is specified, the payment method Id must be defined.

paymentMethodId.description: A valid payment method pre-defined in the current account

Information about the planned databases used to optimise the database infrastructure. This information is only used when
creating a new subscription and any changes will be ignored after this.

creationPlan.description:
Information about the planned databases used to optimise the database infrastructure. This information is only used when
creating a new subscription and any changes will be ignored after this.

memoryStorage.description: Memory storage preference: either ram or a combination of 'ram-and-flash

name.description: A meaningful name to identify the subscription

paymentMethod.description: Payment method for the requested subscription. If credit card is specified, the payment method Id must be defined.

paymentMethodId.description: A valid payment method pre-defined in the current account

alerts.description: Set of alerts to enable on the database

averageItemSizeInBytes.description: Relevant only to ram-and-flash clusters. Estimated average size (measured in bytes) of the items stored in the database

clientSslCertificate.description: SSL certificate to authenticate user connections

dataEviction.description:
(Optional) The data items eviction policy (either: 'allkeys-lru', 'allkeys-lfu', 'allkeys-random', 'volatile-lru',
'volatile-lfu', 'volatile-random', 'volatile-ttl' or 'noeviction'. Default: 'volatile-lru')

dataPersistence.description: Rate of database data persistence (in persistent storage)

externalEndpointForOssClusterApi.description: Should use the external endpoint for open-source (OSS) Cluster API

hashingPolicies.description:
List of regular expression rules to shard the database by. See the documentation on clustering for more information on
the hashing policy - https://docs.redislabs.com/latest/rc/concepts/clustering/

memoryLimitInGb.description: Maximum memory usage for this specific database

modules.description: Modules to be provisioned in the database

name.description: A meaningful name to identify the database

password.description: Password used to access the database. If left empty, the password will be generated automatically

periodicBackupPath.description: Path that will be used to store database backup files

privateEndpoint.description: Private endpoint to access the database

protocol.description: The protocol that will be used to access the database, (either redis or 'memcached)

publicEndpoint.description: Public endpoint to access the database

replicaOfs.description:
Set of Redis database URIs, in the format `redis://user:password@host:port`, that this database will be a replica of. If
the URI provided is Redis Labs Cloud instance, only host and port should be provided

sourceIps.description: Set of CIDR addresses to allow access to the database

throughputMeasurementBy.description: Throughput measurement method, (either number-of-shards or operations-per-second)

throughputMeasurementValue.description: Throughput value (as applies to selected measurement method)

alerts.description: Set of alerts to enable on the database

averageItemSizeInBytes.description: Relevant only to ram-and-flash clusters. Estimated average size (measured in bytes) of the items stored in the database

clientSslCertificate.description: SSL certificate to authenticate user connections
